title: IDFC First Bank approves raising nearly ₹7,500 crore from Warburg, ADIA affiliates
summary: IDFC First Bank has received approval to raise approximately ₹7,500 crore through investments from Warburg Pincus and Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) affiliates.
content:
IDFC First Bank has announced approval for raising capital of nearly ₹7,500 crore through investments from affiliates of global private equity firm Warburg Pincus and sovereign wealth fund Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA). The fundraising initiative is part of the bank's strategy to strengthen its capital base and support future growth plans.

The bank's board has approved the proposed investment which will be executed through a preferential share allotment mechanism. This significant capital infusion is expected to bolster the bank's financial position and enable expansion of its lending activities.

## Capital Raising Initiative

IDFC First Bank has announced approval for raising capital of nearly ₹7,500 crore through investments from affiliates of global private equity firm Warburg Pincus and sovereign wealth fund Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA). The fundraising initiative is part of the bank's strategy to strengthen its capital base and support future growth plans.

The bank's board has approved the proposed investment which will be executed through a preferential share allotment mechanism. This significant capital infusion is expected to bolster the bank's financial position and enable expansion of its lending activities.
